means: 在成本外加一定费用的

sentence.Network_en: All vessels were to be built on a cost-plus basis.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有的船只都将在成本加利润的基础上制造。

sentence.Network_en: Too often, hotels and restaurants set their prices on a cost - plus basis.
sentence.Network_cn: 通常酒店和餐馆的价格是定在成本加利润的基础上.

sentence.Network_en: We are charge for the work on a cost plus basis.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们用成本加成的方法计算工程报价.

entry.def: A cost-plus basis for a contract about work to be done is one in which the buyer agrees to pay the seller or contractor all the cost plus a profit.

example.ex: All vessels were to be built on a cost-plus basis.
example.tran: 所有的船只都将在成本加利润的基础上制造。

means.word_mean: 1. determining payment based on the actual cost of production plus an agreed-upon fee or rate of profit;
